image.altText: GettyImages-2164348602

props.synopsis: Mollie O'Callaghan and Shayna Jack have missed out on medals in the women's 100m freestyle on a busy morning for our Aussies in the pool. Follow live.

title.children: O'Callaghan misses out on 100m medal by the barest of margins after Fox wins more gold

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Swimming: Mollie O'Callaghan and Shayna Jack miss the medals in the 100m final!
JESS FOX HAS WON ANOTHER GOLD MEDAL!!

image.altText: Trinity Rodman hugs a USWNT teammate during a Paris Olympics clash with Australia's Matildas.

props.synopsis: The Matildas lose to the USA 2-1 after Tony Gustavsson is yellow-carded during farcical scenes earlier in the game. Follow live.

title.children: Matildas lose to US after farcical scenes see Aussie coach yellow-carded during lengthy VAR delay

image.altText: Anthony Albanese looks towards the camera with other people surrounding him.

props.synopsis: According to the Productivity Commission, five of 19 Closing the Gap targets are currently 'on track'. That's where the good news ends.

title.children: Two sets of numbers haunted Albanese this week. One brought relief, the other was depressingly familiar

image.altText: An open for inspection sign at a Brisbane apartment, behind it people are entering a building

props.synopsis: Australian house prices rise 0.5 per cent in July, despite Melbourne, Hobart and Darwin recording a fall in values during the past three months, according to new data released by CoreLogic.

title.children: House price data shows drop in values in three cities, but national average still going up

image.altText: Eliana Cheung in Hong Kong.

props.synopsis: The Beijing-controlled government in Hong Kong is luring mainland Chinese to live in the city to shore up the city's faltering economy.

title.children: The Chinese mainlanders moving into Hong Kong under a Beijing-backed plan

image.altText: A man, walking at the front of a large crowd outdoors, holding a framed picture of another man.

props.synopsis: Specifics about how Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh and Hezbollah commander Fuad Shukr were killed on Tuesday are scarce, but one thing is certain: the two high-profile hits will further destabilise the Middle East.

title.children: Two global assassination plots in 24 hours: Is this the day that changes the Middle East?

image.altText: A regional express airplane

props.synopsis: Rex's risky gamble to compete with major airlines on intercity routes may see it back where it started, albeit with greater financial problems.

title.children: What happened to Rex? How a failed bid to take on major airlines via intercity flights brought the carrier down

image.altText: Jess Fox hugs competitors after winning the C1 canoe slalom final at the Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Jess Fox's Olympian parents say the Australian's magnificent C1 gold to add to her K1 title earlier in the Paris Olympics will not be bettered in the sport of canoe slalom.

title.children: Jess Fox rewrites the history books in Paris with 'the most remarkable thing she's ever done'

image.altText: Felicity Chafer-Smith The Torch

props.synopsis: Programs like The Torch in Victoria want to break the cycle of incarceration for First Nations people.

title.children: With Indigenous incarceration increasing, community-led groups say they've got answers

image.altText: Ismail Haniyeh puts his right index finger across his stubbled chin as he tilts his head down slightly and looks forwards.

props.synopsis: With the killing in Iran of Hamas leader Ismael Haniyeh, the possibility that all key players have wanted to avoid — a full-scale war between Israel and Hezbollah — is now closer than ever.

title.children: The assassination that could bring full-scale war — and devastation to three countries

image.altText: Ismail Haniyeh sitting on a chair with a curtain behind him.

props.synopsis: The Palestinian militant group released a statement to say its top political leader has been killed in Iran. No one immediately claimed responsibility.

title.children: Hamas' top political leader Ismail Haniyeh killed in Iran

image.altText: Finances generic

props.synopsis: Australia's annual rate of inflation lifted to 3.8 per cent in the June quarter, up from 3.6 per cent.

title.children: Inflation up but RBA's 'core' target fell, delivering 'good news' on future rate rise

image.altText: A woman with glasses and short hair stares into the camera.

props.synopsis: After a scammer took $1.6 million of her mother's money, Harriet Spring is calling for banks to do more to support victims like herself.

title.children: After losing a $1.6 million inheritance, Harriet Spring says banks need to do more to protect customers from fraud

image.altText: Fencers compete in Le Grand Palais

props.synopsis: Paris offers a rich vein of jewels to house temporary stadiums during the 2024 Olympic Games — but Le Grand Palais, home of fencing, is something else.

title.children: Of all the grand venues being used for the Paris Olympics, the fencing might be housed in the grandest of them all

image.altText: Australian female hockey players, wearing green and gold uniforms, celebrate as a dejected USA goalkeeper walks past.

props.synopsis: Australia's women's hockey team continues its early Olympic dominance, taking care of the USA 3-0 in humid conditions to record their third consecutive win.

title.children: Hockeyroos remain perfect in Paris with 3-0 win over USA

image.altText: A woman standing near a home, holding a gun.

props.synopsis: Vision released by Queensland police shows dramatic moments during the final shootout after a six-hour siege at Wieambilla in December 2022.

title.children: Footage shows final moments of shootout with police after six-hour Wieambilla siege

image.altText: A young white man with short brown hair and glasses out the front of Parliament House in Canberra. He is a wheelchair user

props.synopsis: The federal government has revealed its response to the landmark disability royal commission, but has not committed to a number of the most contentious recommendations.

title.children: Disability advocates 'devastated, disappointed and caught off guard' by royal commission response

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and sunglasses walks between two police officers.

props.synopsis: Former British TV news presenter Huw Edwards pleads guilty to three counts of making indecent pictures of children.

title.children: Former long-time BBC presenter Huw Edwards pleads guilty to making indecent images of children

image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiling as an excited voter, a young woman, takes a selfie with him.

props.synopsis: Threats against Australian politicians have almost doubled over the past two years but calls for greater police protection could be stymied by a pay dispute.

title.children: Threats to MPs almost double over two years

image.altText: Luke Greenbank of Great Britain reacts to being told he has been disqualifed, looking in disbelief

props.synopsis: British swimmer Luke Greenbank, who won bronze in the mens 200-metre backstroke in Tokyo, has been disqualified after winning his heat in Paris.

title.children: British swimmer left 'speechless' after being disqualified from heat he won

image.altText: A group of people holding signs and wearing tshirts saying Don't Torch Journalism.

props.synopsis: Journalists at Nine newspapers are set to receive an 11.5 per cent pay rise over three years after accepting a new offer from management following a strike.

title.children: Journalists from Nine newspapers reach pay agreement with management after five-day strike

image.altText: Female Olympic triathlon starts with competitors diving into the River Seine

props.synopsis: After delays, cancellations and far too much talk about poo, the River Seine was finally given its chance to shine, highlighting an important issue about the health of our major rivers.

title.children: The Seine was flowing, the race was on, and Paris had its chance to shine once more

image.altText: The tiktok logo on a black board

props.synopsis: The mass food poisoning incident saw 17 ambulances and a decontamination vehicle called to the office in the business district, with more than a dozen still in hospital receiving treatment.

title.children: 130 people hit by food poisoning at TikTok HQ with dozens hospitalised in Singapore

image.altText: Donald Trump in front of a purple background with the words "Team Trump".

props.synopsis: The director of the "Project 2025" plan for a Donald Trump presidency steps down after Democrats made attacking it central to their election campaign and Trump repeatedly distanced himself from it.

title.children: Project 2025 director ends work on plan for Trump presidency after continued attack from Democrats

image.altText: Two guards lock a padlock and chain across a metal gate

props.synopsis: Palestinians incarcerated in Israeli jails are being subjected to multiple forms of torture and deprivation, the UN human rights office has said in a report, while calling for their immediate release.

title.children: Detained Palestinians waterboarded and tortured in Israeli prisons, UN report says

image.altText: Sabrina James and Marjorie Johnston share a laugh

props.synopsis: In the midst of a housing crisis, roughly 12 million bedrooms sit empty. But housemates Marjorie Johnston and Sabrina James reckon they have hit on a solution.

title.children: With millions of bedrooms empty, this unusual pair have hit upon a housing solution

image.altText: The historic Billson's Brewery with two chimneys and a faded antique sign on the side

props.synopsis: The owners of a popular drinks company in North East Victoria have described the "excruciatingly difficult" decision to put their business into voluntary administration.

title.children: Jobs at risk as historic Billson's Brewery announces voluntary administration

image.altText: Two women water polo athletes hug in the water wearing red helmet caps

props.synopsis: Fast, exciting and taking the game on. That's how Australia's women's water polo team wants to play and they were all that and more in a nailbiting Olympics victory against the Netherlands.

title.children: Stingers gamble with substitute keeper to win dramatic pool shootout and see off Dutch

image.altText: A group of three Olympic medals - with silver, gold and bronze left to right - are shown against a dark background.

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes have won today — and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here's the medal standings for day five of the Olympic Games

image.altText: ess Morrison of Australia and Annabelle McIntyre of Australia competing in a pairs rowing race

props.synopsis: Jess Morrison and Annabelle McIntyre have given the Australian Olympic rowing team a much-needed boost by winning their women's pair semifinal.

title.children: Aussie pair provide much needed relief for Olympic rowing campaign

image.altText: A woman sits in a wheelchair out the front of a court complex.

props.synopsis: Hunter Valley man Mark Creighton will be eligible for parole on Christmas Eve. His victim, who was almost run over during the incident, says the crime continues to haunt her.

title.children: Jail for father who helped son carjack paraplegic woman outside pool

image.altText: A screenshot of a youtube video stating that it is unavailable in the viewer's region

props.synopsis: It's the second time an ABC investigation has been geo-blocked in India for its journalism.

title.children: YouTube blocks ABC Four Corners investigation into India's 'nest of spies' targeting Australian critics after Indian government's demand

image.altText: A horse getting misted at the Olympics

props.synopsis: From extra breaks to umbrellas and electric fans, competitors and fans at the Paris Olympics are getting inventive to keep cool.

title.children: How Olympians, horses and fans are keeping cool during Paris Games heatwave
